column1: #Text=which is situated on the north shore of the St. Lawrence River , at its meeting point with the Saguenay River Fjord .
#Text=Tadoussac , which started as a trading post , is the oldest still existing French settlement in the western hemisphere .
#Text=Explorer Jacques Cartier visited the area in 1535 , followed by Pierre de Chauvin in 1599 and Samuel de Champlain in 1603 .
#Text=The first official fur trade post in Canada was established in 1600 ; the village ( which celebrated its 400th birthday in 2000 ) boasts of many homes more than a century old .

#Text=A small village hidden in a mountain valley , Tadoussac occupies a privileged position at the maritime crossroads of the Saguenay fjord and the majestic St. Lawrence river , with sand dunes and a small lake in the heart of the village .
#Text=Quebec Route 138 crosses the Saguenay River from Saint-Siméon by ferry .
#Text=This is the usual means of entry into the area from Quebec City and points westward .
#Text=From Tadoussac , Route 138 continues downriver beyond Sept-Iles .
#Text=There is also ferry service across the St. Lawrence from Saint-Siméon to Rivière-du-Loup .

#Text=A highway ( 172 from Tadoussac or 170 from Saint-Siméon ) follows the fjords of the Saguenay river westward to Chicoutimi-Jonquière ( as this is mostly parkland , there are no services and no cell towers on this road ) .
#Text=A bridge crosses the Saguenay in Chicoutimi-Nord .
#Text=, 414 , rue du Bateau Passeur ( Motel Restaurant Chantmartin ) , ☏ +1 418-235-4733 .
#Text=Intercity bus once daily from Québec City .
#Text=Passengers originating in Montréal will incur a seven-hour trip ( leaving at 6AM , then transferring from Orleans Express at Abraham-Martin ) .
#Text=Tadoussac is at the confluence of the St. Lawrence and Saguenay rivers and accessible seasonally by boat .
#Text=, 100 rue Bord de l’Eau , ☏ +1 418-235-4585 , fax : +1 418-235-4795 . late May-mid October .
#Text=Marina with boat ramp , gas and diesel , on-site boutique , restaurant and bar .
#Text=( Club de yacht de Sacré-Coeur ) , 346 , ch. de l'anse de Roche , Sacré-Coeur G0T 1Y0 ( Rivière Saguenay , 15 km/9 miles upstream of Tadoussac ) , ☏ +1418 236-4325 , fax : +1418 236-4514 .
#Text=You can walk from and to anywhere in town .
#Text=( Marine Mammal Interpretation Centre ) , 108 rue de la Cale-Sèche , Tadoussac G0T 2A0 , ☏ +1418 235-4701 , fax : +1418 235-4325 .
#Text=, 367 rue des Pionniers , Tadoussac G0T 2A0 , ☏ +1418 235-4306 , toll-free : +1-800-463-5250 .
#Text=The area is well known for its whale watching opportunities on the St. Lawrence River ; multiple companies offer excursions on small boats .

#Text=One of the best sites south of the Arctic to see beluga whales ; fin whales , minke whales and harbour porpoises are particularly common , with humpback whales and blue whales also sometimes visible .
#Text=Most boat tours are seasonal , running from May to September .

#Text=Excursions up the Saguenay River provide the opportunity to see belugas , as well as at least three species of seal ( grey seal , harbour seal , harp seal ) which give birth on the rocky shores .
#Text=Run excursions in small boats of up to 12 passengers ( 2 or 3 hour duration ) .
#Text=, departs from marina , 100 rue du Bord de l'Eau , ☏ +1 418-235-3333 .
#Text=Whale watching aboard a 12-passenger zodiac boat , fjord excursions , sea kayaking .
#Text=Restrictive cancellation policy , no toilets on board .
#Text=There are restaurants at various hotels in the area .
#Text=, 87 Principale , Les Bergeronnes G0T 1G0 ( Route 138 from Tadoussac , then left ) , ☏ +1 418-232-6779 , toll-free : +1-866-637-6663 , fax : +1 418-232-1007 .
#Text=This same organisation conducts Mer et Monde Écotours , which depart from Tadoussac ( 148 rue du Bord de l'eau ) .
#Text=Constructed in 1865 , this seasonal ( May – October ) hotel has three restaurants , a bar , six holes of miniature golf , an outdoor tennis court and outdoor pool with lifeguard .
#Text=24-room motel with cable TV , Internet and 120-seat café/restaurant , open year-round , near snowmobile trail and ferry .
#Text=Clean , well organised camping ground . $ 28 ( camping spot ) .
